comment.author: 23103743@N05
23103743@N05
comment._content: Another candidate is Dr. Charles A Eaton mentioned in NYT of Jan 25, 1914 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0C15FF355D1373... as a member of the National Lawn Tennis Ranking Committee.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Or Dr Charles A Eaton of the Madison Avenue Baptist Church making a statement about the Lusitania in NYT of May 10, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60D10F8395B1773...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think it's the last, given the NYT of February 7, 1916 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20D16FB3B5B17738... which announced his resignation. "DR. EATON RESIGNS; PLANS LITERARY LIFE; Pastor of the Madison Avenue Baptist Church to Aid in World's Reconstruction. WANTS A LARGER AUDIENCE Clergyman Sees as Great a Need for Spiritual as for Physical Preparedness."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In which case, he is en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Aubrey_Eaton The photo seems compatible. Photo at bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=E000023 for EATON, Charles Aubrey, a Representative from New Jersey is definitely similar

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: He is clearly en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Aubrey_Eaton - this photo is printed in The sun., February 10, 1918, Section 5 Magazine Section, Page 8, "Key to Victory Is Ships, Says Dr. Eaton - Noted New York Clergyman Explains Just Wy We Are at War" - obviously the reverend was a strong proponent of war.

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: Sleuthed to a fare-thee-well!  We'll update the record.
